Package bankteller.demo1

Class AccountDatabase

java.lang.Object
bankteller.demo1.AccountDatabase
public class AccountDatabase extends Object
This class represents a database of all types of bank accounts.
Author:
Afsana Rahman, Mini Sinha

  • Constructor Details

    • AccountDatabase

      public AccountDatabase()
      Constructor that initializes a new account database, able to hold up to 4 accounts.

  • Method Details

    • getAccounts

      public Account[] getAccounts()
      Method that returns the current list of accounts held in the database.
      Returns:
      list of accounts in current database

    • getNumAcct

      public int getNumAcct()
      Method that returns the current number of accounts held in the database.
      Returns:
      number of accounts in current database

    • find

      private int find(Account account)
      Method that finds a given (open or closed) account in the current database
      Parameters:
      account - account to be searched for
      Returns:
      index of the account in the database -- returns NOT_FOUND if not found

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Method that creates space in the database to hold more accounts by adding 4 more possible account slots.

    • open

      public boolean open(Account account)
      This method serves as a function to either open a new account or reopen an existing account. New accounts must have valid information to be opened in the database. A new account cannot be created if the same account already exists in the database. Account holders can only have one Checking or one College Checking account in the database.
      Parameters:
      account - account to be opened/added to the database
      Returns:
      true if the account was successfully opened, false otherwise

    • addAcc

      private void addAcc(Account account)
      Method that adds account to the next available slot in the account list in the database.
      Parameters:
      account - account to be added to the database

    • validAccount

      private boolean validAccount(Account account)
      Method that checks the validity of a new account to be opened. Valid accounts must have a valid date of birth (valid date in the past), an initial deposit greater than $0, and follow the requirements for its specific account type (College Checking accounts must have valid campuses and Money Market accounts must have initial deposits greater than $2500).
      Parameters:
      account - account to be checked for credentials
      Returns:
      true if the account is valid, false otherwise

    • close

      public boolean close(Account account)
      This method serves as a function to close an existing open account. Account must already exist in order to be properly closed. If the account is any type of Savings account, the Loyalty will be changed to 0 (non-loyal).
      Parameters:
      account - account to be closed
      Returns:
      true if account was successfully closed, false otherwise

    • deposit

      public void deposit(Account account)
      This method serves as a function to deposit a valid given amount to an existing open account.
      Parameters:
      account - account holding information of account to be deposited to and balance to be withdrawn

    • withdraw

      public boolean withdraw(Account account)
      This method serves as a function to withdraw a valid given amount from an existing open account. The account must have a sufficient balance to withdraw the amount requested; balances cannot become negative.
      Parameters:
      account - account holding information of account to be withdrawn from and amount to be withdrawn
      Returns:
      true if withdrawal was successful, false otherwise

    • print

      public String print()
      This method acts as a function to print all accounts in their current ordering.

    • printByAccountType

      public String printByAccountType()
      This method acts as a function to print all accounts ordered by account type.

    • printFeeAndInterest

      public String printFeeAndInterest()
      This method acts as a function to print all accounts and their monthly fees/interest.

    • sortByAccountType

      private void sortByAccountType()
      Method that sorts the current list of accounts by account type. Order of priority is Checking, College Checking, Money Market, then Savings.
